Mutation_Information.Mutation_Description: The M26I mutation reduces DJ-1 expression, particularly in a null background (knockout mouse embryonic fibroblasts).
The mutations of peripheral redox sites (C46A and C53A) and M26I also led to constitutive ASK1 binding.
The mutations of the central redox site specifically abolished binding to ASK1 and the cytoprotective activity of DJ-1.
C106A mutation of the central redox site specifically abolished binding to ASK1 and the cytoprotective activity of DJ-1.

The peripheral cysteine mutants retained cytoprotective activity, whereas the PDassociated mutant [M26I]DJ-1 failed to suppress ASK1 activity and nuclear export of the death domain-associated protein Daxx and did not promote cytoprotection.
